text.message: Example of non-character speaking for a very long time, what could they be speaking about? Who knows really... it's a massive mystery. I don't know myself and I'm the creator!
I am hungry! Do you think you could get me something to eat? It'd really be good and I'd really, really appreciate it buddy.
Hello, it's me! Surprise!
I am hungry too!
Now I am hungry!
I am always hungry...
How you doin'?
Oh... you like me...
Don't you?
Nah not really ya ugly
Oh...
I am hungry now!
I am hungry too!
Now I am hungry!
I am very angry.
I have a lamp like that in my room!
We could do with some more characters!
Well, we have the table. Maybe we can do something with that?
The group approached the statue. Kate shivered, both the chill of the prison and the ominous look the statue appeared to be sending her delivering a frosty grip on her spine.
Let's just get outta here...
I'm feeling really bad.
I am starting to feel
Queasy...
I hear ya...
That thing gives me the creeps!
It's my mum... they turned her to stone!
Numbers from 1 to 26... what could they mean?
The mirror had taken Albert's eye immediately. He approached it.
It's a full length mirror.
Heyy... looking good!
I've slept on more comfortable beds when I've been camping!
But still... maybe just five minutes... aaaaaah...
Was everything in this room made to be uncomfortable?
Oooooh... nothing in this bin.
There's loads of stuff on this table! Let's have a look.
Whoa! It just started playing music!
Hey, check out these books! I've read almost all of these. Phantom, The Diary of Anne Frank, Frankenstein... there are some classics here.
These books have to mean something! Is this anything in them?
Albert flipped through all the books in turn.
Nope. Nothing in them. No messages, no highlighted words, no secret compartments for wedding rings... nothing.
Sigh...
Maybe one day someone will propose to me using a book.
Okay, so there's nothing in them, but these weren't put here randomly. I know it!
It's a red glowing light. I don't think this means anything.
It's a whiteboard, but there's no pen, so I can't write anything on it.
Not that I would if I had a pen, of course...
Then again, a penis could be funny...
It would have to be a really big one!
But not too big!!!
I don't mind a big one
Neither do I.
A really big one.
Not as big as mine though.
Are you serious?
Yes...?
Hmmmmm
Are you guys done?! I've had it up to here with all your dumb bullshit, you little bastards!
You forgot about me!
Noooooooooo!
Usual...
Zzzzzzzzz
Where the hell am I?!
The lock reads {0}-{1}-{2}-{3}
When I was a child my family owned a dog. That dog was called Fido.
Fido was the most loving dog any family could ask for. He would sit by the front door, waiting for my dad to get home from work, and he would sit there for hours, the whole day sometimes.
Fido was also very protective of us, the children especially. He would follow us around the house in our younger years, and once scared off a cat after it scratched my sister.
While sitting at the front door, Fido would jump up and bark at the postman and would tear up letters that came through the letterbox. This act would regularly annoy every member of the household.
One day, when my 'mama' was in the garden, someone tried to break into the house by putting their arm through the letterbox. Fido was there to bite the person's arm and he - or she - ran away.
I know this because there was a trail of blood that dripped down the front door and if you look closely you can even see the faint stain today.
When I was older, maybe six or seven years old, I chased Fido around the house and accidentally fell over. I fell right on to Fido.
Fido, in defence, bit my arm. He didn't bite it hard. It didn't hurt me too much. I was hurt by the fact that Fido had bitten me rather than the act itself.
However, Fido drew blood and that evening my father took Fido to the vet's. He was put down immediately.
I wasn't there to see Fido die, but I have wondered ever since:
As my father watched the life leave from Fido's eyes, what did he see there? Did he see malice? Did he see sadness? Did he see ignorance?
I have two questions for you now. Do you think that Fido deserved to die?
And, regardless of your answer to that question: Was it right for Fido to die on that day?
There were many things that could have woken Albert up.
The bright light beaming straight down at him, making the back of his eyelids glow, could have woken him up, but it didn't.
The drone, low and repetitive, that began shortly after Albert was placed in the room and ended a few minutes before he eventually did wake, could have woken him up, but it didn't.
The nightmare he was having, in which he was being chased by an unknown, phantom man, should have woken it up, but it didn't.
What did wake Albert up was the chill in the room.
It was not always so cold, but suddenly the temperature dropped and the air Albert breathed delivered an icy touch as it passed through him.
This is what woke Albert up.
Albert rubbed his heavy eyes, yawned, and looked around the room. It looked like he was in a bedroom of sorts.
How the hell did I get here?
He stretched his arms.
That must have been a wild night...
I don't remember anything!
Saying the fact out loud somehow made it all more real. Albert had experienced some heavy nights in the past - especially in his university days --
That night with Carlosita...!
But there'd never been anything quite like this. He always at least remembered preparing to go out for the night. Now, though, he could recall absolutely nothing.
The heck happened to me?
I gotta get outta here.
Albert rose from the bed and looked around at his surroundings. There was a door opposite the bed.
Alright then!
Hey, a CD player! If only I had my S Club 7 CD!
There were photos on the desk.
Three randomers. What's with the candles?
Well, no S Club 7. I'll listen to them later.
Some books. This shelf is really high up though. I can't reach them.
Did an ambulance smash into the other side of this wall or somethin'?
This is kinda strange to have on your wall?
I think my poster of Mila Kunis is way better!
Have these windows been boarded up?
I can't even tell if it's day or night outside!
Although... I am sorta sleepy.
Eh? It's not opening?
Thing must be jammed.
Albert pulled and pulled at the door, but it wasn't budging.
It must be locked.
It dawned on Albert that he wasn't in a good situation.
This is creepy.
Maybe I'm in a dream?
Albert pinched himself lightly... then pinched himself again, harder.
Ouch!
Ok then. Not a dream.
Albert peered through the window, but it was pitch black outside.
Hello? IS THERE ANYONE ALIVE OUT THERE?
Albert whistles.
There's no response.
Guess I kinda jynxed that one by quoting Titanic.
Oh, jeez... what am I gonna do?
This is the worst hangover ever.
....... well, maybe not as bad as the time Spongy pushed me into that lake.
Albert pressed his face against the glass of the door, straining his eyes to try to look outside, and banged on the door.
C'mon already! Let me outta here!
But nobody came to Albert's cries.
What do I do now?
Still locked. Still nobody out there.
Wait a sec!
SPONGY? IS THIS YOU? LOOK, I'M SORRY ABOUT THE SOUP THING... I DIDN'T REALISE YOU'D EAT IT ALL BEFORE REALISING WHAT WAS IN THERE!
There's still no answer.
Hmm...
Well I'm not getting anywhere by standing here waiting. Let's check out the room.
Why ARE there numbers here anyways?
It's a bin. Yay?
I might be trapped in this room, but nothing - NOTHING - will make me a bin raider.
Look, I'm not doing it. I'm not looking through someone's bin.
I'm not doing it! Stop asking already!
Please don't make me do it.
What's wrong with you?! Fine!
I'll do it!
Albert looks into the bin, except...
It's empty. Completely empty!
I hope you're pleased.
Nothing's gonna magically appear in that bin! Leave it already!
Eh? This radiator's turned on but it's freezing in here!
Shivering, Albert touched the radiator.
YOUCH!!!!
It's red hot!
Albert, feeling sorry for himself, stuck his fingers in his mouth to lick his wounds.
This room has some crazy heat loss going on!
I'm not touching that again! :(
Hey, I can use this chair to look up at that shelf!
Oh, I am such a genius.
This is why Profe Fonseca put me in that classroom with that tutor all for myself!
This drawer is being kept shut by two locks! TWO!
There must be something very secret inside! Something somebody wants nobody to see!
What if there's a hundred thousand euros inside?
What about secret government documents about UFOs???
OR MAYBE.......... A girl's nude pictures???
I have to get in here!
Uh, for the secret government documents...
Huh. Just a few books.
I was kinda hoping to find something else up here?
Wait! There must be something inside the books!
Proud of himself, Albert picked up each book in turn and flipped through it, expecting perhaps a key or a code to fall out. Maybe a page number would be circled, or a word highlighted, but...
Nothing at all!
Maybe there's something in the--
As Albert leaned over to pick up a pick he lost his balance, and...
WHOA!!!
My face... it
hurts
Let's... try that again...
There's nothing in any of these books. Do they mean anything at all?
There's Dracula, Frankenstein, Hamlet, The Diary of Anne Frank, The Phantom of the Opera, The Time Machine...
I've read most of these, apart from The Time Machine.
Maybe I need to make something from the titles? The Diary of Dracula? The Phantom of the Machine?
WAIT ONE SECOND!
Anne Frankenstein!
That has to be it!
Okay, so maybe not... but what then?
These books HAVE to mean something!
Wait, aren't these books ordered alphabetically?
Three photos of three different people. I've never seen them before?
Viola is pretty cute!
Albert picks up the photo frames, opens them up, and looks at the backs of the photos and the frames. There's nothing there.
Aww... that's where I'd hide a secret code.
What are these photos here for?
These nametags read 'Elizabeth', 'Viola' and 'Danielle'
Three nametags, three girls - I guess these are the names of the girls in the photos?
The first letter of each name is in a different font. E for Elizabeth, V for Viola, D for Danielle.
Candles... Somebody must have lit these recently.
So maybe someone will be back soon! Yay!
Three candles, three girls... What's going on here?
Huh, radio. What's going on with that radio?
I can't access any radio stations on it at all! There go my hopes of finding an S Club song on.
There's a CD slot in this stereo. Hmmmm...
The radiator's plugged into this socket.
These wheels are barely moving!
Albert went to sit on the bed and it slid slightly on the floor.
Maybe when I get out I can find a long hallway and speed all the way down it on this bed!
Nope... nothing under the pillow or mattress.
Weird. The other bed swings about like crazy, but this one doesn't budge an inch.
I'll turn this off... my poor fingers are so sore!
Albert bent over and turned off the radiator at the plug socket.
He turned and sat on the bed behind him, pondering now about how he had reached his place. He searched his memory, but it was as though he'd had a very heavy night of drinking.
It was in the evening... I was coming back from the cinema...
Yeah, that's right...! I'd gone to see Jurassic World with the guys.
I was... on my own... it was late. I was walking home.
Did I get home?
His memory was fragmented, even of his walk back home that night. He remembered the sound of a car skidding around a corner, and remembered the glare of a streetlight through raindrops.
Had something happened to him then?
What if, maybe, I was hit by a car, and I'm dead?
Albert could almost see the concerned faces that people would make at him.
Uh... maybe not then.
I have to find a way out of here.
At that moment, there was a sound from the corner of the room.
It was quiet, like whispers riding on gusts of wind swirling around the room.
Nevertheless, it made Albert jump and he almost instinctively scurried to the back of the bed.
He sat there, listening to the sound, goosebumps raising on his arms.
What... the... fuck...
The sound was coming from the corner of the room, by the mirror. Albert stared over at the place but could see nothing. Gradually he put his shaking feet on the floor and walked over to the mirror.

The voice was louder here, and Albert peered into the mirror. All he saw was his own frightened face staring back at him. He placed his ear against the mirror, wondering if there was perhaps a speaker behind it.
Then, suddenly, the voice got clearer.
Albert gulped.
H..hello?
Silence.
Then...
Hel....
Hello?? Hello?
The image in the mirror looked strange. Streaks of dark blue seemed to drip like heavy droplets of blood over objects in the reflection.

Albert looked back at the room, expecting to see the strange blue phenonemon, but the room was the same as ever. He looked back into the mirror to see that the blue was dripping everywhere now, crawling even across the bed as though it was being dragged along by some unseen force.
What the hell is going on?
Soon the entire reflection of the room was covered in blue, as though it was a crime scene with blue blood splattered everywhere, and then another image faded into view in the center of the mirror.
It was blurred at first but gradually became clearer, like an object rising from the depths of the ocean. An object --- or a person.
HELLO?!
It was the face of a man, but he didn't seem to hear Albert. He stared straight back into Albert's paralyzed eyes for what seemed like eternity... and then he opened his mouth.
Hello??? What???
The man stared at him, squinting, before his face began to fade away in much the same way as it had originally appeared.
Wait! What?! No!
But the man's face faded quickly, and the image left behind in the mirror was just a normal reflection: any trace of the blue substance was gone.
Hello? Can you hear me?
There was no answer.
Albert felt tears welling up in his eyes. The idea that he was being pranked was long gone now. There was something very, very wrong about where he was and he was sure that he wasn't dreaming.
Somehow, Albert found that he was backed up against the bed, and fell back on to it, cupping his head in his hands.
I..... what am I gonna do?
Fuck.
Albert stood up, a rush of anger and adrenaline surging through him.
Look! Whoever's doing this.... stop! Seriously! Let me out!
Please...
Albert fell back on to the bed. He looked down at his hands to see that they were shaking.
F-f-fuck...
Angry at himself for no reason other than to be angry, he grabbed his right hand with his left in order to stop them both from shaking.
Fuck... fuck it... I've got to get out of here...
Maybe I can...
There's got to be a way out of here.
The radiator's turned off. It's cooled down now.
The screws on the side of this radiator don't match it at all.
Albert started unscrewing the screws on the radiator and as he did so, a sticky, thick, black substance started to leak from it.
Whoa! What is this?
Albert put his nose close to the lukewarm radiator and sniffed.
Is it... oil?
Albert screwed the screw back into the radiator.
Maybe I can find something to collect this oil?
I should find something to collect the oil that's in this radiator.
Maybe I can use these to collect the oil.
Albert picked up the three candles and blew them out. The flames on each flickered once, taking a dying breath, before vanishing.
He scooped out the wax in each candle and looked around the room for where he could stick it.
Eh... this will do...
He stuck the wax on the underside of the table. His fingers hit something sticky there.
Hey, gross!
There was a huge wad of gum stuck on the underside of the table!
Albert used the screwdriver to once more unscrew the radiator, and collected the oil that dripped out of it in the candles.
Okay, I've got the oil. Is there anything around here that needs oiling up?
C'mon, there's gotta be something...
I think I'm all done with this radiator now.
Wait, I can use the oil to loosen up this wheel!
Huhuhuhuh! Yeah! YEAH, BABY!!! YEAH!
Albert oiled the wheel up and the bed immediately shifted. Something dropped down next to Albert.
Huh? Must've been trapped against the bed...
YES! It fits!
I'm going to restart the CD from the beginning.
I don't think I need to do anything more with this wheel.
I wonder if the candles were put there for me to use them?
Albert placed the CD in the CD slot of the radio and immediately music began to play.
It's a whiteboard, but there's no pen, so I can't write anything on it.
Not that I would if I had a pen, of course...
Then again, a penis could be funny...
It worked?
There was a clunk from the door.
Albert pulled the handle down on the door and, somewhat to his surprise, the door gave way. It shifted, meaning...
I can go.
Albert opened the door and looked out. It was completely dark, but as he took as step outside he could see... what was that...? A wheel...?
Albert was unable to take another step forward before a low drone filled the air.
What the...
A voice came from behind Albert - from inside the room.
I  s e e  y o u
Albert turned.
There was a man, tall and thin, whose bones didn't seem to fit together right, suddenly standing there beside the mirror.
What the fuck?
Albert saw now that the man was holding a sort of hunting knife.
You come here.
FUCK THIS!
Albert turned to flee out of the room but he couldn't take one step before the man, swift, was on his back.
He felt a sharp blow to the back of his head and fell straight down.
Agh!
His head hit the floor hard.
There was an intense pain to his forehead and shades of red saturated his vision.
n o
A heavy weight pressed down on Albert's spine. The man was sitting on his back.
The man tore Albert's cap off his head and threw it across the room, then pulled his head back by the hair.
wh

The man drew his knife back and in one motion swung it around, effortlessly piercing Albert's cheek. The knife stabbed through the middle of his tongue. The man did not flinch and immediately withdrew the knife.
Blood ruptured through Albert's mouth as his screamed.
You're only the first.
The man shot Albert's head down against the floor. Albert's nose crashed into the hard flooring, the cartillage shattering, and then everything stopped and all was dark.
